transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to the show! Tonight my guests are pork roast and fishwich... (stomach growls) I mean Michael Stipe and Lassie. So, how was your weekend, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mine was good too. Eh, say, what's with the action figure?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah. What's with the action figure?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We exist in a boundless time continuum. There is no weekend!

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: (while Zorak is talking) Hello... Hello... Hello.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, this is my nephew, Raymond.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what do you want to be when you grow up?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Isn't that cute? He can't say apocalypse! Watch this... Hey kid, say "spaghetti".

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room, reading book "Reading is Fun For Mentals") Poc-a-lypse. Pocalypse

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, you bugs must have billions of relatives, what with all the eggs you lay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Don't ghosts hang around attics and go "boo"? Jerk!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Weren't your mother's people dung beetles?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (shouting) I am the Lone Locust of the Apocalypse!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Think of me when you look...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, now you're a locust again! Well silly me, I thought you were a mantis!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "I am the Lone Mantis of the Apocalypse."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait, better yet: "I am the Lone Fill-in-the-blank of the Apocalypse." How's about that, Zorak, leave enough room for you there, hmm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And how about you start wearing a shirt to work from now on, Jack?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you guys as hungry as I am?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with western accent) Mmmmmm! Hungry, like Hungry Jack hungry?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, hungry like a muscled-up GI Joe after a tough day in the chopper.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Oooh, action figure with life-like tears. (aloud) You want a pizza, Raymond?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Heh heh... Moltar, establish contact with a pizza parlor! (Zorak & Raymond keep shouting "Pizza!" in the background)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yes, hang on... all right... okay, let me, uh... (throws lever)

transcript.speaker: Mujibur & Sirajul
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor, waving) Hi, Dave, hi Dave...

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Sal's Pizza Emporium, we bake it, you buy it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ah hah... (zaps image to Space Ghost's monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, pizza merchant. We wish to order a pie with...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We'd like a pizza with bloated orange roughy, please.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, wait! Sun-bloated, yeah, get it sun-bloated!

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah. Hey, Mookie! Gimme one large pie, with sun-bloated orange roughy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whatever. My first guest is one of several thousand collies who have gone by the name of Lassie. But this is the real one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shh! Don't startle the dog guest.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gee, you're a nice doggy, Lassie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what you been up to?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I know! Does it ever itch right here?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You could get some salve. (No response) Okay. Now here's a high-pitch sound only you can hear. AAAAAAAAAEEEEEAAAAAEEEAAAAHHHH!! Uh!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You idiot! We can all hear that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You say Brak was bitten by a rattlesnake?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's at old man Tibby's farm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Farms have chickens. Corn! Let's ride! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (returns) Uh, where's that farm again? (monitor screen is just static) (in low voice) Oh, she's gone. (normal voice) Say, is that pizza here yet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What say we enjoy the aroma of food with my smell ray. Stand back! (zap!)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (screen shows words "INSERT HORSE") Oh, yeah, that's Jumbles.

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor) Look, Iron Man, for the last time, I can't send you a raw pizza.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Just gimme the dough, I can cook it in twenty seconds.

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Twenty seconds? What you got over there, a nuclear reactor?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sal, Sal, listen... Gimme the dough.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, where's that pizza? It's been over five minutes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah, the pizza man. Greetings, pizza merchant. Greetings, pizza merchant.

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: ... Nobody cooks pizza in only twenty seconds.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's my horse. Is he okay?

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: So is the horse all right or what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know. Hey! Where's my pizza?

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's like this. Mookie, the guy making your pizza, right, turns out he's allergic to orange roughy, so he got all hivey and stuff, but now he's making you another pie.

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Whoahoahoa! Hey, Mookie! You gotta check this out! The baby maggot's talking!

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Hey, that horse, he don't look so good. What's his name? Jingles?

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Jumbles. He looks lame. You better put him down.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look here, pizza man. I'm Space Ghost, I'm hungry, I've got a talking voodoo doll taking chunks out of my horse and I want my pizza! (pounds fist)

transcript.speaker: Sal
transcript.dialogue: Okay, okay. Just trying to help.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right. So we're, we're okay, we're fine?

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: Quit steppin' on me! Stop it! Stop!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You better slap a muzzle on that scaled down piece of evil.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Jumbles, walk it off. (pause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What are those things on your face?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Those are my intergalactic space glasses.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh. What can you do with those?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: I can see right through you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Mr. Magno-Specs, your new album's called "Monster"? What's up with that?

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: The new record is, um, it's like, uh, it's a, it's a...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (mocking, in unison) Uh, it's a, it's a ...

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: It's a, it's a, it's like a layman's, it's like a layman's, it's like a layman's, like a layman's, a layman's, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a, ummmm, it's like a layman's, ummm, there's stuff on your lip, uh, layman's, uh, layman's, uh, layman's, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: on, on, tip of my tongue, on...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Mike, I'm going to send you a high-pitched message that only you can hear!

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: (tilts head to one side) No message, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then, sing that song, sing that, "Shiny Shiny People" song.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll get you started. (sings) "Shiny shiny people, shiny shiny people..."

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: I hate that song, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, me too, Michael, me too. Say, Mike, do think I'm a shiny shiny person?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't see some dark, horrible corner inside of me somewhere?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I have a question. Is that you in the corner?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (points) That way, in the corner! (picture of Zorak's band, with Michael Stipe's face in lower right corner of screen, rubbing front teeth)

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: That's me in the corner, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So what's next for you? What's on your plate? (stomach growls) Ohh!

transcript.speaker: Michael Stipe
transcript.dialogue: Um, I'm going to drive to dinner.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: C'mon, Stipe! Give us a break! Buy us some dinner!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, how about him, will he take us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Great! See ya! (zaps MS off screen of main monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (to MS in control room) Just me, Moltar, outta lines, hangin' out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) I'm so hungry, I'm lightheaded! (aloud) May I have a hall pass, Miss Steckler? I wanna go home now, Miss Steckler... (passes out & comes to)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (mocking) I wanna go too, Miss Steckler.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (shouting) That's barbaric! (quietly) Is there any left?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) I'm gonna miss the little guy. (screen fades & freezes)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in foreground) Let's look back at all the fun we had with our special friend, Raymond.

transcript.speaker: (Melancholy background music plays. Screen title
transcript.dialogue: "Raymond, A Special Friend". Still shots of:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sounding light-headed) I think I should see the nurse, Miss Steckler. (shouting) Moltar! Get me that pizza boy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not Dave. I'm Space Ghost! Who are you two?

transcript.speaker: Mujibur Rahman
transcript.dialogue: I am Mujibur, and this is Sirajul.

transcript.speaker: Mujibur Rahman
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm, Space Ghost, that's the name on our pizza. (points to pizza box labeled "To Space Ghost, Ghost Planet")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's a good Jumbles. Feeling better now?
